Articles.Content:
Recently I made a set of letter and number textures and a separate decal part to display them, for purposes like writing names on ships. Do you mind if I share them here to download as an addon (if you could call it that) for the mod?

[image moved into other post]

Edited February 21, 2019 by voicey99

On 2/19/2019 at 5:19 PM, voicey99 said:

Recently I made a set of letter﻿ and number textures and a separate decal part to display﻿ them, for purposes like writing names on ships. Do you mind if I share them here to download as an addon (if you could call it that) for the mod?

 

Not at all, please go ahead

I was looking for a mod that would let me write names on the sides of my ships, and couldn't find anything. So I decided to fix that and, with the tools of NEBULA, created a set of letter and number textures you can use to assemble names letter-by letter on the sides of your ships to grant them names they can bear proudly for all to see, and to label things like different sections of your bases.

   The current texture set.

Download it here

To install, download the folder and drag and drop it into GameData, and merge it with the existing NEBULA folder.

The characters are text size 180, written in the font Arial Black, and the flat and curved letter decals are clones of the standard flat and letter decals.

UPDATE 27/02/19 - Added some basic punctuation (dot, dash, slash, apostrophe, comma).
UPDATE 21/03/19 - Added curved versions of the Letter Decal.

Edited March 22, 2019 by voicey99

On 2/21/2019 at 6:43 AM, voicey99 said:

If needed I can make alternative textures or fit them onto the curved decal.

Curved would be amazing! Thank you for sharing this and packaging it up for easy installation.

On 3/16/2019 at 5:59 PM, Captain Planet said:

Curved would be amazing! Thank you for sharing this and packaging it up for easy installation.

I've added two curved versions of the letter decal (one for writing each way along the curved surface), and an additional set of textures for the rotated version to the download.

When installed via CKAN conflicts with Nebula Eva handrails continued.

Report :

File: GameData / NEBULA / MiniAVC.DLL file
Mod Installation : NEBULADecalsContinued 0.1.2.2
Owning Mod: EVAHandrailsPackContinued
Ckan version: v1.25.4

I've updated the EVAHandrailsPack, CKAN should see the update sometime in the next few hours
Is miniAVC necessary? I just cut it out everywhere.

15 hours ago, Craze said:

Is miniAVC necessary? I just cut it out everywhere.

some people find it helpful. There's a ZeroMiniAVC mod out there you can search for that will disable the DLLs it finds in any mod for you automatically if you don't want to deal with it

5 hours ago, Drew Kerman said:

some people find it helpful. There's a ZeroMiniAVC mod out there you can search for that will disable the DLLs it finds in any mod for you automatically if you don't want to deal with it ﻿

I know that. But a lot of DLL is a huge amount of disk space and a lot of CPU time to disable them. I made a program for myself that removes them.

Hello! I made a texture pack for Nebula, 87 textures, download here -> beacuoupzero texture pack, just overwrite gamedata. hope you enjoy.

9 hours ago, beaucoupzero said:

Hello! I made a texture pack for Nebula, 87 textures, download here -> beacuoupzero texture pack, just overwrite gamedata. hope you enjoy.

 

Are you offering this up as an addin to the current mod?  Or as a secondary download?

Either way, you totally left out the README.md and the LICENSE (two copies are included).

Are you offering this up as an addin to the current mod?  Or as a secondary download?

Either way, you totally left out the README.md and the LICENSE (two copies are included).  

hey,  it would be awesome to have these included in the mod !!!! please let me know what steps need to be taken. i`m prepared to make bigger resolution items if necessary and i want to expand the curved vertical selection that has no decals atm. let me know!

hey,  it would be awesome to have these included in the mod !!!! please let me know what steps need to be taken. i`m prepared to make bigger resolution items if necessary and i want to expand the curved vertical selection that has no decals atm. let me know!

I'd be happy to include them. They are a nice group of decals

I'm busy with some other stuff.  It would be best if you were able to do a PR on Github, otherwise, just PM me a zip file and I'll do a manual merge

On 11/27/2018 at 2:48 AM, sslaptnhablhat said:

Like I said, I did exactly as described in the OP; created custom decals and entered their filenames in the CFG files, separated by semicolons. Nothing more, nothing less.

Has this user ever been answered?

I also created a 512x512 png file. Put it into "GameData\NEBULA\decals\textures"

I added it's filename (only before the extension) at the end of "textureNames =" after "rusroundel" with a ";" semicolon before it, into the config.cfg, configCurvedHorizRect.cfg, configCurvedSquare.cfg, configCurvedVertRect.cfg files, but it still isn't showing up in the game.

When I right click on the related parts in the VAB, the last varient still reads as "rusroundel".

My file name doesn't have any special characters, it doesn't even have uppercase letters...

What could be wrong?

EDIT:  disregard:  I didn't realize it was a part!  BTW, seems to work fine in 1.8/1.8.1, and does not require tweakscale, but I can see why it would be recommended.  I ran into some probllems with tweakscale, and don't have it installed.  as of this date, tweakscale is not updated for 1.8

Does this mod work with 1.8/1.8.1?  and does it require or recommend tweakscale?  I've read both, the spacedock page says requires, this post says recommennded. And if installed, how is it activated?  I see new flags and decals in the flags menu, but when I right click a part, I don't get an option to add or resize  a flag/decal.  Just not sure how it's supposed to work.  Thanks

Edited October 29, 2019 by Torch

That the point, you need Tweakscale to adjust the size of you decal on your craft.

Since 1.8.1 is out it seems last version of Tweakscale works, the UI is back.
it seems that the mod doesn't work well in KSP1.7.3. It can't load the texture correctly in VAB and flight
i know this mod is old, but what is the rocket in the image which shows the decals?

I love all the documentation on how to create custom logos, but I'd be happy if I could even figure out how to use the included ones. Can someone link the instructions on how to use the base mod?? I've installed it through Curse and either I'm blind or there is nothing new in my VAB for this. Please help? I'm not new to modding, but I am new to modding KSP.
